title: Guarding the Patchwork

panel_structure.description: The Architect as fighter in defensive stance, protecting something precious yet visibly patchwork—identity as quilt of borrowed pieces
Close-up revealing what's being guarded—a patchwork self made of borrowed language, metaphors, expectations, held with holy fierceness

transformation_notes: The fighter disguise is perfect—we battle to defend identities we know are borrowed, not because they're authentic but because they're all we have to call home.
